M11/3/PSYCH/BP1/ENG/TZ1/XX




     22115702

PSYCHOLOGY
HIGHER LEVEL and standard LEVEL
PAPER 1

Tuesday 3 May 2011 (afternoon)

2 hours


INSTRUCTIONS to candidates

 Do not turn over this examination paper until instructed to do so.
 Section A: answer all the questions.
 Section B: answer one question.




2211-5702                                                                                           2 pages
                                                            © International Baccalaureate Organization 2011
                                                   –2–                 M11/3/PSYCH/BP1/ENG/TZ1/XX

                                                SECTION A

Answer all questions in this section. Marks will be awarded for focused answers supported by relevant
knowledge.

Biological level of analysis

1.    Explain how one hormone influences human behaviour.                                     [8 marks]


Cognitive level of analysis

2.    Describe one research study which has investigated schema theory.                       [8 marks]


Sociocultural level of analysis

3.    Outline two errors in attribution.                                                      [8 marks]




                                                SECTION B

Answer one question in this section. Marks will be awarded for demonstration of knowledge and
understanding (including the use of relevant psychological research), evidence of critical thinking
(e.g. application, analysis, synthesis, evaluation), and organization of answers.

4.    Discuss ethical considerations related to research conducted into genetic influences
      on behaviour.                                                                          [22 marks]


5.    To what extent do social or cultural factors affect one cognitive process?             [22 marks]


6.    Discuss factors influencing conformity.                                                [22 marks]
